name: electricity production, hydro, reservoir, alpine region, renewable energy products | electricity, high voltage, renewable energy products | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9426/documentation

This dataset represents the production of certified high voltage electricity at grid-connected reservoir hydropower plants in Switzerland in 2009. Here, the reservoir hydropower plants are modelled with alpine region plants based on data from Swiss hydropower plants. A representative sample of Swiss dams with a height of more than 30 metres is taken into account for calculating the input. Lifetime is assumed to be 150 years for the structural part and 80 years for the turbines. Net average electrical efficiency, including pipe losses, is  78% (best efficiency can be 84%).

This dataset starts from the power plant ready to produce electricity, i.e. the reservoir filled with water

This activity ends with 1kWh of high voltage electricity produced at the power plant and arrived at the busbar. 

This dataset includes 
 - the area/volume occupied for the barrage, power station, and the lake
 - a preliminary estimation of emissions of methane and dinitrogen oxide
 - operation and maintenance activities and materials of the power plants, such as lubricating oil or mass of water passing through the turbines. 


This dataset doesn't include
 - land use for access roads to the reservoir
 - emissions of carbon dioxide
 - raw materials extraction, decommissioning and waste treatment as these activities are already included in the infrastructure datasets 
 - transformation of the electricity produced.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Inventory represents Swiss data for label-certified electricity.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The module describes average installed technology with an efficiency of 78%, including pipe losses (best technology has 82%).

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=CH
Estimation. This dataset is based on data of Swiss reservoir power plants. The lubricating oil is in a closed loop system (i.e. cannot get into the turbined water system) and is disposed annualy as waste oil in a hazardous waste treatment plant. The information given is based on own assumptions.

exchanges.description: Estimation based on Swiss reservoir volumes.
Calculated value based on literature values and expert opinion. See comments in the parametres' comment field.

Literature value/estimation. The specific turbine water amount is inversely proportional to the average  head. A guidance value says that a hydropower plant can produce 1kWh of electricity with 1 m3 water over a head of 450 m. The ecological relevance of the turbine water amount is that it presents a demonstrative dimension of water being taken from natural water balance for a while.

flow.name: Water, turbine use, unspecified natural origin

exchanges.description:
Estimation. The emissions of methane are lower in alpine regions than in warmer regions. Total emissions of greenhouse gases are assumed to be 0.3 CO2equivalents per kWh. Methane emissions are a function of the flooded area, depth of the reservoir, flooded bimoass, surrounding temperature and climatic zone. 

Gross methane emissions of natural Swiss lakes are assumed to amount to 40 kg/ha*y (Egger 1995). Further assumptions are the total area of Swiss reservoir plants (7000 ha) and the electricity production of those plants as an average of the years 1991-2000 (20'000 GWh/y).
It can be assumed the the actual methane emissions are lower than the resulting 0.014 g/kWh because of the high altitude of the reservoirs. There, only little biomass is flooded and the low temperatures constrain anaerobic degradation of the biomass.

Egger K.W. (1995) Methanemissionen der Schweiz und deren
Klimawirksamkeit. In: Gas - Wasser - Abwasser, 3/95 (1995), S. 224-234.

flow.name: Methane, non-fossil
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description: Calculated value based on literature values and expert opinion. See comments in the parametres' comment field.

Estimation. Total emissions of greenhouse gases are assumed to be 0.3 CO2equivalents per kWh. Research projects in Swiss natural lakes had measurements of 8-16 μmol per m2 and day (brutto emissions). Because of the limited rates of nitrification and denitrification, a maximum of 0.24 to 2.4 μmol per m2 and Tag can be assumed for Swiss reservoir plants.

flow.name: Dinitrogen monoxide
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description:
Estimation. Data for a run-of-river power station were overtaken. 
There, a consumption of lubricating oil for turbines of 9 liters per GWh is estimated. With an oil density of 0.84 kg/l this amounts to 0.007 g/kWh. The lubricating oil is in a closed loop system (i.e. cannot get into the turbined water system) and is disposed annualy as waste oil in a hazardous waste treatment plant.
